meanings.definition: Not constructive; not helpful or productive.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints were nonconstructive and only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent2: The team realized that arguing over small details was nonconstructive to their overall goal.
meanings.sent3: His nonconstructive attitude towards the project made everyone laugh at his lack of positivity.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed nonconstructive to the sunny picnic they had planned.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's nonconstructive feedback left the student feeling lost and unsure of how to improve.

meanings.definition: Tending to hinder rather than contribute to progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The constant delays were nonconstructive to the completion of the project.
meanings.sent2: His negative comments were nonconstructive to the team's morale.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn mule's nonconstructive behavior made it impossible to move forward.
meanings.sent4: The tangled mess of wires was nonconstructive to setting up the new computer system.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was nonconstructive to the driver's visibility on the road.
